cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SW of Port-au-Prince, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northward, forecast to cross Haiti and eastern Cuba, then track through the Bahamas and parallel or slightly offshore of Florida’s east coast toward the southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-western Haiti (first landfall) then eastern Cuba; closest U.S. coastal encounter expected along the southeast Florida coast near the Bahamas

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Interests in the Florida Peninsula and Keys should monitor the progress of Matthew
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings now in effect for Jamaica, Haiti, eastern Cuba, and the southeastern Bahamas (no U.S. warnings yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Haiti, eastern Cuba, southeastern and central Bahamas, then potentially the Atlantic coastline of Florida northward to the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds possible late Thursday into Friday with a 33% chance of ≥34 kt and 13% chance of ≥50 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the hurricane tracks close to shore, water rises of 2–4 ft above ground level are possible along Palm Beach County beaches and inlets.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 4–6 inches of rain with localized higher totals, producing ponding and brief flash-flood conditions.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large surf, dangerous rip currents, and long-period swells will affect port approaches well before the center passes.
